Options to use globally, that get sent to
. For example, decimal point separator ('.' or ','). Useful tip:
The above options can also be provided as

to the highcharts components. When provided as props, the props will be used instead. Module options are useful when you want the same feature applied globally, like exporting. Props are preferred when you only want to have those options affect individual components.
The nuxt-highchart module adds a plugin which registers the following components:
The basic chart component (but still very powerful! see the demo)
The highstock chart component, shorthand for `
The highmap chart component, shorthand for `
. This is where you can specify animation duration.
instance to use, defaults to an instance imported by the plugin.
{ mapName: 'myMapName', mapData: [you provide this, see examples] }
can be either the JSON or string pointing to the json file
Highcharts modules to load. These modules are in

Enable/disable highcharts-more. Some charts, such as polar and bubble, require this to be enabled. NOTE: Highcharts library deliberately leaves out the features to avoid bloating the library. Only specify
when you want those extra features
Contains an array of specific options to watch. Is extremely useful for speeding up the reactivity! Default:

all the options' properties. Easy to use, but can impact performance.
into the current context, so that on any component, you can access the following properties:
- the components registered by the plugin
Emitted after successfully mounting any of the above components. It will provide an instance of the chart, so should you wish to use the Highchart API directly you can using that instance.

html .light .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-light);background: var(--shiki-light-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-light-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-light-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-light-text-decoration);}html.light .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-light);background: var(--shiki-light-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-light-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-light-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-light-text-decoration);}html .dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}html.dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}
